## Working remotely with sublime text.

There are two basic scenarios.

**Edit random files**

To do that, i'd recommend using rsub. There is a [great tutorial by tedbot](http://log.liminastudio.com/writing/tutorials/sublime-tunnel-of-love-how-to-edit-remote-files-with-sublime-text-via-an-ssh-tunnel) explaining how to do that.


**Working on a remote project**

In this case you want to work on a particular part of your file system. In order to archive this, you want to mount the remote directory over ssh. [Here](http://xmodulo.com/2013/04/how-to-mount-remote-directory-over-ssh-on-linux.html) you'll find a comprehensive tutorial how to set up sshfs, which enables you to simply do something like:

```$ sshfs username@yourhostname.com:/path/to/remote/directory /path/to/local/```
